result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kejuan Dawan Turner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kejuan Dawan Turner in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Kejuan Dawan Turner in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the State Court ordered case DISMISSED AND READ-IN.

Defendant Kejuan Dawan Turner in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. A no contact order was ordered on case #15CM2905.  A motion hearing was scheduled on this case and that case so that the defendant would be produced, and informed of the no contact order. Case adjourned to Branch 23. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Kejuan Dawan Turner in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Kejuan Dawan Turner in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No reply from defendant or surety.  vp
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($25.00) gj
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 25.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Matter before court for a scheduling conference.   The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed: positive drug test on 6-15-2015. Court takes no action and will address the matter on the next court date.

15RM029130  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06-14-2015

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Kejuan Dawan Turner in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  
Defendant Kejuan Dawan Turner in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.
Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Kejuan Dawan Turner not in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for calendar call 4-29-2015.  The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue. Court does not forfeit bail.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for pretrial conference. Defense counsel requests a calendar call date. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 04-29-2015.  Calendar call scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RICARDO S. OR MILLER COORS PROPERTIES:  651 N 39TH ST. AND 3939 W HIGHLAND BLVD.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kejuan Dawan Turner in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Defendant Kejuan Dawan Turner in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
